Rahul Gandhi Says "Way Blocked" After BJP MP Injured In Parliament Showdown - NDTV
summary:
BJP Blames Rahul Gandhi for Violence in Parliament Amid Protests

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: NDTV

Protests erupted in Parliament following a controversial remark by Home Minister Amit Shah, with accusations of violence exchanged between BJP and Congress MPs.

Key Points:

  • Two BJP MPs were reported injured during the altercation, which BJP attributes to Rahul Gandhi's actions.
  • Congress claims BJP MPs caused the confrontation by blocking Gandhi from entering Parliament.
  • The incident has led to legal action threats from the BJP against Rahul Gandhi.
  • Amit Shah's remarks regarding Dr. Ambedkar sparked significant backlash, prompting protests.
‚ÄúParliament is not a wrestling arena,‚Äù said Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju, criticizing Gandhi's behavior.

This incident highlights the escalating tensions between the ruling party and the opposition amid ongoing debates over controversial remarks.

title: SpiceJet resolves $16-million dispute with aircraft lessor Genesis; shares jump nearly 9% - Upstox
summary:
SpiceJet Settles $16 Million Dispute with Genesis, Shares Surge Nearly 9%

Date: Recently Source: Bombay Stock Exchange

SpiceJet shares saw an increase of nearly 9% following the airline's announcement of a settlement with Genesis, resolving a $16 million dispute.

  • The airline will pay $6 million in cash and issue $4 million in equity.
  • The dispute resolution includes the withdrawal of all ongoing litigations.
  • Chairman Ajay Singh emphasized the settlement's importance for financial stability.
  • Previously, SpiceJet settled disputes with multiple lessors.
  • SpiceJet aims to operate 35 aircraft by March 2025, expanding to 100 by FY27.
‚ÄúThis agreement... will significantly reduce our financial liabilities and further strengthen our balance sheet.‚Äù - Ajay Singh

This settlement marks a significant step in SpiceJet's ongoing efforts to stabilize its financial situation and improve operations.
newTitle: SpiceJet Settles $16 Million Dispute with Genesis, Shares Surge Nearly 9%

summary:

Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya stated that banks have recovered ‚Çπ14,131.60 crore from him against a judgement debt of ‚Çπ6,203 crore, arguing he is entitled to relief unless banks can justify this recovery amount.

  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reported a total recovery of ‚Çπ22,280 crore from various economic offenders.

title: California Governor Declares State Of Emergency Due To Bird Flu - NDTV
summary:
California Governor Declares State of Emergency Due to Bird Flu

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 | Source: CBS News

California Governor Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency in response to an outbreak of Avian influenza A (H5N1), commonly known as bird flu, which has infected 34 people in the state.

  • The declaration follows the detection of the virus in dairy cattle in Southern California.
  • No person-to-person transmission of bird flu has been identified in California.
  • A large testing and monitoring system has been implemented across the state.
  • Nationwide, 61 human cases of H5N1 have been reported since April.
  • California has distributed protective gear to dairy farms for enhanced safety.
No person-to-person transmission of bird flu has been identified in California. Most individuals infected in the state were exposed to infected cows.

The declaration underscores the urgency of enhancing monitoring and response measures to mitigate the spread of the virus amidst rising cases.
newTitle: California Governor Declares State of Emergency Due to Bird Flu

Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route - India Today
summary:
Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route

Published On: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: India Today

Ispace, a Tokyo-based lunar exploration company, has announced its second lunar mission targeting a soft landing on the Moon's Sea of Cold.

  • The six-day launch window opens in mid-January 2025.
  • The mission will deploy a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.
  • The lunar lander will take several months to reach the Moon using a low-energy trajectory.
  • Mission 2 aims to execute a lunar flyby and soft landing, utilizing backup sites for mission flexibility.
‚ÄúMission 2 represents our continued commitment to the lunar economy,‚Äù said Takeshi Hakamada, Founder & CEO of ispace.

This mission underlines the synergy between private space companies and international agencies, enhancing the development of a robust lunar economy.
newTitle: Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route

title: 6 things to do while walking to improve heart health - The Times of India
summary:
6 Things to Do While Walking to Improve Heart Health

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Walking is one of the simplest and most effective ways to keep our heart in good shape. Adding a few extra activities into your walking routine can bring big rewards for heart health. Here are 6 things you can do while walking to boost your heart health.

  • Walk with purpose: Increase the pace to improve blood circulation and strengthen the heart muscle.
  • Add intervals: Alternate between brisk and slower walking to challenge your cardiovascular system.
  • Use your arms: Swinging arms or holding light weights can enhance aerobic activity and calorie burn.
  • Incorporate breathing exercises: Deep breathing while walking can lower stress levels and improve oxygen saturation.
  • Take nature walks: Walking in green spaces reduces stress hormones and promotes better heart health.
  • Track your steps: Aim for 7,000‚Äì10,000 steps daily to reduce the risk of heart disease.
"Every small effort counts toward a healthier heart."

Walking is great for heart health, and these activities can enhance your routine. Start today by making small changes that can lead to big benefits.
newTitle: 6 Things to Do While Walking to Improve Heart Health

title: NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth On THIS Date, Check Time, Speed And Dis - Times Now
summary:
NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Times Now

NASA is keeping a close watch on two house-sized asteroids, 2024 XQ4 and 2024 XN15, which will make their closest approaches to Earth on December 21, 2024. NASA confirms that they pose no threat to our planet.

  • Asteroid 2024 XQ4 has a diameter of 50 feet and will pass within 1,060,000 kilometers of Earth at 47,634 km/h at 3:03 PM IST.
  • Asteroid 2024 XN15 is approximately 60 feet in diameter, passing at a distance of 3,780,000 kilometers at 35,051 km/h, closest at 2:38 PM IST.
  • Both asteroids do not classify as Potentially Hazardous Objects according to NASA's criteria.
  • NASA utilizes a network of telescopes for tracking Near-Earth Objects to assess their trajectories and risks.
‚ÄúNeither of these asteroids classifies as a Potentially Hazardous Object (PHO).‚Äù

This monitoring highlights the effectiveness of NASA's tracking systems, ensuring public safety while observing celestial phenomena.
newTitle: NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth

Asian Paints shares fall 3.4% to hit 52-week low after two top executives resign, check details - Upstox
summary:
Asian Paints Shares Plummet to 52-Week Low Following Executive Resignations

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Upstox

Asian Paints Ltd. experienced a significant drop in share price, reaching a 52-week low after the resignation of two top executives. The stock fell by 3.4% in early trading on December 19, marking its fourth consecutive session of decline.

  • Asian Paints' share price declined to ‚Çπ2,265.35, reflecting an 8% drop this month and over 32% in 2024.
  • Executive resignations include Shyam Swamy and Vishu Goel, effective December 17, 2024.
  • The company did not provide details regarding the reasons for the executives' resignations.
  • New appointments were announced for Ashish Rae and Gagandeep Singh Kalsi to fill management roles.
  • Recent stock declines attributed to rising competition and inflation affecting demand in the paints industry.
‚ÄúThe paint industry faced subdued demand during the period.‚Äù - Asian Paints

In conclusion, the challenges of increasing competition and the economic climate are exerting pressure on Asian Paints, contributing to its declining stock performance.
newTitle: Asian Paints Shares Plummet to 52-Week Low Following Executive Resignations

title: Israel hits Yemen‚Äôs ports, tells Houthis ‚Äòwill reach you‚Äô - The Hindu
summary:
Israel hits Yemen‚Äôs ports, tells Houthis ‚Äòwill reach you‚Äô

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Israel conducted strikes on strategic locations in Yemen after intercepting a missile fired by Houthi rebels. The Israeli Defense Minister warned the Houthis that they would also be targeted.

  • The Israeli military targeted ports and energy facilities used by Houthi rebels.
  • Houthi media reported casualties and damage to infrastructure in Sanaa and Hodaidah.
  • This action is part of an ongoing conflict where Houthis have launched multiple missiles towards Israel.
  • Israeli officials characterized the Houthis as a significant threat, echoing concerns about Iranian support for the group.
  • Israel's military stated it would respond to threats from any group in the region.
"I warn the leaders of the Houthi terrorist organisation: Israel's long arm will reach you too," - Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz.

This escalation underscores the growing regional tensions as the Houthis align their operations with the conflict in Gaza, promising to continue attacks until a ceasefire is achieved.
newTitle: Israel Strikes Houthi Targets in Yemen Following Missile Interception

title: Central India Crowns Pushpa 2 as the All-Time Box Office Champion, Surpassing Baahubali 2 - PINKVILLA
summary:
Central India Crowns Pushpa 2 as the All-Time Box Office Champion, Surpassing Baahubali 2

Publication Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has officially become the highest-grossing film in Central India, with box office collections reaching Rs. 135 crore nett, surpassing the previous record held by Baahubali 2, which earned Rs. 123 crore.

  • Pushpa 2's total box office collections in India stand at Rs. 552.50 crore nett.
  • The film is set to close the gap with other top-grossing films, including Stree 2 and Jawan.
  • Pushpa 2 is especially popular in Central India, which includes Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and parts of Gujarat and Maharashtra.
  • Only two other films have crossed Rs. 100 crore in Central India: Gadar 2 and Stree 2.
‚ÄúPushpa 2 is expected to widen the gap by a final number of over Rs. 175 crore.‚Äù

This achievement underscores the growing dominance of regional films in the Indian box office, challenging the traditional Bollywood hits.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Becomes All-Time Box Office Champion in Central India

Blocked 18 OTT platforms for publishing obscene, vulgar content: Govt - The Hindu
summary:
Government Blocks 18 OTT Platforms for Obscene Content

Published on: December 19, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The government has taken action against 18 Over-the-Top (OTT) platforms for publishing obscene and vulgar content, according to Minister L. Murugan in the Lok Sabha.

  • The blocking occurred on March 14, 2024, under the IT Rules of 2021.
  • Intermediaries have specific duties to prevent the display of obscene or pornographic content.
  • There is a Code of Ethics for digital media publishers, requiring adherence to 'Norms of Journalistic Conduct.'
  • The central government has the authority to block content for various national interest reasons.
‚ÄúThe Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has taken action in coordination with various intermediaries, and blocked 18 OTT platforms...‚Äù

This decision aims to regulate the content available on digital platforms and maintain public order.
newTitle: Government Blocks 18 OTT Platforms for Obscene Content

title: Five terrorists killed in encounter in south Kashmir‚Äôs Kulgam - Greater Kashmir
Dow Jones breaks 1974 record after Fed rate cut decision - Details - ET Now
summary:
Dow Jones Breaks 1974 Record After Fed Rate Cut Decision

Date: Updated Dec 19, 2024
Source: ET NOW

The US stocks finished sharply lower on Wednesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average posting its worst day in over four months after the Federal Reserve decided to lower its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 4.25-4.50% range but reduced its forecast for further rate cuts in 2025.

  • The Dow Jones lost 1,123.03 points, or 2.58%, closing at 42,326.87.
  • The Nasdaq Composite fell 716.37 points, or 3.56%, ending at 19,392.69.
  • The S&P 500 skidded 178.45 points, or 2.95%, settling at 5,872.16.
  • Deepak Jasani stated it was the worst loss for the S&P 500 on the day of a rate decision since 2001.
  • The Dow experienced its 10th consecutive decline, the longest since October 1974.
‚ÄúUS stocks and bonds sold off after the Federal Reserve ended its policy meeting Wednesday with a new set of economic projections that pointed to a potentially slower pace of interest-rate cuts next year than previously forecast.‚Äù

This decision by the Federal Reserve has led to significant market reactions, with stocks declining sharply and concerns growing over inflation pressures.
newTitle: Dow Jones Breaks 1974 Record After Fed Rate Cut Decision

title: 5 mesmerising space findings by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - HT Tech
summary:
5 Mesmerising Space Findings by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: December 3, 2024 | Source: HT TECH

This article highlights five remarkable discoveries made by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope that have expanded our understanding of the universe.

  • The telescope has been operational for over three decades, providing incredible insights into deep space.
  • One finding showcases the spiral galaxy IC 3225, resembling a cannonball in space.
  • Another discovery is of spiral galaxy UGC 10043, located 150 million light-years from Earth.
  • Hubble captured a spectacular image of Galaxy M90, revealing its dusty disk and bright core.
  • Galaxy NGC 4694 was imaged at a distance of 54 million light-years in the Virgo cluster.
‚ÄúNASA‚Äôs Hubble Space Telescope has made several first discoveries and provided astronomers with a great view of deep space.‚Äù

These findings not only contribute significantly to our astronomical knowledge but also inspire future explorations and discoveries in space science.
newTitle: 5 Mesmerising Space Findings by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

title: 'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
summary:
'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, recognized as one of cricket's premier fast bowlers, recently surpassed Kapil Dev's record to become India's top Test wicket-taker in Australia.

  • Bumrah has overcome significant back issues to excel in cricket, achieving a record of 53 wickets in Australia.
  • He was the player of the match in India's first Test victory in Perth, claiming nine wickets in total.
  • His average of 10.90 makes him the standout bowler of the series, well ahead of his Australian counterparts.
  • Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting praised Bumrah, calling him India's greatest fast bowler across all formats.
  • Travis Head noted Bumrah's potential to be one of the greatest fast bowlers ever.
  • Despite questions regarding the legality of his bowling action, legends like Greg Chappell have defended him.
  • Bumrah's unique bowling technique has consistently troubled batters and earned admiration from players around the world.
‚ÄúHe is definitely India‚Äôs greatest fast bowler.‚Äù - Ricky Ponting
‚ÄúJasprit is probably going to go down as one of the greatest fast bowlers to play the game.‚Äù - Travis Head

Bumrah's remarkable achievements and comeback after injury solidify his legacy as a key player in Indian cricket history.
newTitle: 'India's greatest fast bowler...': Aussies in awe of Jasprit Bumrah
